column1: '''Erelas''' was one of the seven [[warning beacons of Gondor]]
column2: the fourth that would be lit when [[Minas Tirith]] called for aid from [[Rohan]]. It was a bald green hill
column3: with no trees or plants. Its attendants would set fire to their beacon when they saw a flame on [[Nardol]]
column5: and their own beacon-fire would be answered by that on the peak of [[Min-Rimmon]] to the west. All these beacon hills lay among the [[White Mountains]] as they came down into the plains of [[An√≥rien]]
column6: the fief of [[Gondor]] that lay on Rohan's borders.<ref>{{UT|Cirion}}</ref>

column1: On the night of [[7 March]] {{TA|3019}} [[Gandalf]] and [[Peregrin Took|Pippin]]
column3: saw the beacons being lit to call for aid from [[Rohan]].<ref>{{RK|V1}}</ref>

column2: ''Erelas'' was not a Sindarin name. The true meaning of the name is lost in history.<ref name=VT42>{{VT|42a}}
